name.richardson.james.bukkit.utilities.command

Interface Command

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CommandExecutor, PermissionsHolder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PluginCommand

    public interface Command
extends CommandExecutor, PermissionsHolder

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor

        onCommand

      • Methods inherited from interface name.richardson.james.bukkit.utilities.permissions.PermissionsHolder

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(CommandSender sender)
             throws CommandArgumentException,
                    CommandPermissionException,
                    CommandUsageException
        Execute a command.
        Parameters:
        sender - The CommandSender using this command.
        Throws:
        CommandArgumentException - if any of the arguments are invalid.
        CommandPermissionException - if the player does not have permission to use the command.
        CommandUsageException - if the command is being used in an inappropriate way.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Gets the description.
        Returns:
        a brief description of what the command does.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Gets the name of this command.
        Returns:
        the name of the command.

      • getUsage

        String getUsage()
        Gets the usage.
        Returns:
        a brief string detailing how to use the command.

      • parseArguments

        void parseArguments(String[] arguments,
                  CommandSender sender)
                    throws CommandArgumentException
        Parse and validate the given command arguments.
        Parameters:
        arguments - the arguments provided by the CommandManager
        sender - the sender
        Throws:
        CommandArgumentException - if any of the arguments are invalid or missing.

      • testPermission

        boolean testPermission(CommandSender sender)
        Check if a player has permission to use this command.
        Parameters:
        sender - the CommandSender attempting to use the command.
        Returns:
        true if they are allowed to use the command, false otherwise.
